frontmatter.title: Neuro-Symbolic AI Summer School (8-9 Aug 2022)
frontmatter.description: Page for IBM Neuro-Symbolic AI Summer School 2022

internal.content:
---
title: Neuro-Symbolic AI Summer School (8-9 Aug 2022)
description: Page for IBM Neuro-Symbolic AI Summer School 2022
date: 26 May 2022
---

## IBM Neuro-Symbolic AI Summer School 2022

#### August 8-9, 2022

## Day 1

<EventTable>
  <EventSession>
    <EventSessionHeader
      title="Session 1: Opening"
      time="08:30 - 10:30ET"
    ></EventSessionHeader>
    <Agenda>
      <AgendaItem>
        <AgendaItemHeader
          title="Opening"
          duration="20 minutes"
        ></AgendaItemHeader>
        <AgendaItemDesc>
          <AgendaItemDescItem text="Welcome (Alexander Gray - IBM)"></AgendaItemDescItem>
          <AgendaItemDescItem text="Motivation (Francesca Rossi - IBM)"></AgendaItemDescItem>
          <AgendaItemDescItem text="Summer school Intro (Jon Lenchner - IBM)"></AgendaItemDescItem>
          <AgendaItemDescItem text="NS Badge (Asim Munawar - IBM)"></AgendaItemDescItem>
        </AgendaItemDesc>
      </AgendaItem>
      <AgendaItem>
        <AgendaItemHeader
          title="Neuro-symbolic AI overview ()"
          duration="1 hour"
        ></AgendaItemHeader>
      </AgendaItem>
      <AgendaItem>
        <AgendaItemHeader
          title="IBM’s perspective (Alexander Gray - IBM)"
          duration="40 minutes"
        ></AgendaItemHeader>
      </AgendaItem>
    </Agenda>
  </EventSession>
  <EventSession>
    <EventSessionHeader
      title="Session 2: Knowledge"
      time="11:00 - 13:00ET"
    ></EventSessionHeader>
    <Agenda>
      <AgendaItem>
        <AgendaItemHeader
          title="Knowledge Foundations for AI Applications (Maria Chang - IBM)"
          duration="1 hour"
        ></AgendaItemHeader>
        <AgendaItemDesc>
          <AgendaItemDescItem text="Knowledge Acquisition and Induction"></AgendaItemDescItem>
          <AgendaItemDescItem text="Semantic Web"></AgendaItemDescItem>
          <AgendaItemDescItem text="Logic for AI"></AgendaItemDescItem>
        </AgendaItemDesc>
      </AgendaItem>
      <AgendaItem>
        <AgendaItemHeader
          title="IBM Research Overview Part 1: Universal Logic Knowledge Base (Rosario Uceda-Sosa - IBM)"
          duration="25 minutes"
        ></AgendaItemHeader>
        <AgendaItemDesc>
          <AgendaItemDescItem text="Interlinked KBs for broad encyclopedic, linguistic, and commonsense knowledge"></AgendaItemDescItem>
          <AgendaItemDescItem text="Supporting foundation for neuro-symbolic reasoning"></AgendaItemDescItem>
        </AgendaItemDesc>
      </AgendaItem>
      <AgendaItem>
        <AgendaItemHeader
          title="IBM Research Overview Part 2: Logic language and hyperknowledge (Guilherme Lima - IBM)"
          duration="25 minutes"
        ></AgendaItemHeader>
        <AgendaItemDesc>
          <AgendaItemDescItem text="Higher order reasoning"></AgendaItemDescItem>
          <AgendaItemDescItem text="Python and SPARQL integration"></AgendaItemDescItem>
          <AgendaItemDescItem text="Hyperknowledge infrastructure"></AgendaItemDescItem>
        </AgendaItemDesc>
      </AgendaItem>
      <AgendaItem>
        <AgendaItemHeader
          title="IBM Research Overview Part 3: Deep linguistic processing (Alexandre Rademaker - IBM)"
          duration="10 minutes"
        ></AgendaItemHeader>
        <AgendaItemDesc>
          <AgendaItemDescItem text="Minimal recursive semantics and abstract meaning representation"></AgendaItemDescItem>
          <AgendaItemDescItem text="Open source tooling"></AgendaItemDescItem>
        </AgendaItemDesc>
      </AgendaItem>
    </Agenda>
  </EventSession>
  <EventSession>
    <EventSessionHeader
      title="Session 3: Reasoning"
      time="13:30 - 15:30ET"
    ></EventSessionHeader>
    <Agenda>
      <AgendaItem>
        <AgendaItemHeader
          title="A Very Brief Introduction to Logic and Reasoning (Achille - IBM)"
          duration="1 hour"
        ></AgendaItemHeader>
        <AgendaItemDesc>
          <AgendaItemDescItem text="First order logic (FOL) syntax and model theoretic semantics"></AgendaItemDescItem>
          <AgendaItemDescItem text="FOL reasoning and deductive systems"></AgendaItemDescItem>
          <AgendaItemDescItem text="FOL Extensions"></AgendaItemDescItem>
        </AgendaItemDesc>
      </AgendaItem>
      <AgendaItem>
        <AgendaItemHeader
          title="Learnable Reasoning (Ndivhuwo - IBM, Hima Karanam - IBM)"
          duration="1 hour"
        ></AgendaItemHeader>
        <AgendaItemDesc>
          <AgendaItemDescItem text="Overview of Learning to Reason (e.g., neural theorem provers, MLNs, LTNs, etc)"></AgendaItemDescItem>
          <AgendaItemDescItem text="Introduction to LNNs - our framework for Learnable Reasoning"></AgendaItemDescItem>
          <AgendaItemDescItem text="Applications of LNNS"></AgendaItemDescItem>
        </AgendaItemDesc>
      </AgendaItem>
    </Agenda>
  </EventSession>
  <EventSession>
    <EventSessionHeader
      title="Session 4: Theory of Reasoning"
      time="16:00 - 18:00ET"
    ></EventSessionHeader>
    <Agenda>
      <AgendaItem>
        <AgendaItemHeader
          title="Foundations of Reasoning with Classical Logic (Marco Carmosino - IBM)"
          duration="30 minutes"
        ></AgendaItemHeader>
        <AgendaItemDesc>
          <AgendaItemDescItem text='Desiderata: what is a logic, and what makes a logic "good"?'></AgendaItemDescItem>
          <AgendaItemDescItem text="Example: First-Order Logic on finite graphs."></AgendaItemDescItem>
          <AgendaItemDescItem text="Game-based semantics for First-Order Logic"></AgendaItemDescItem>
        </AgendaItemDesc>
      </AgendaItem>
      <AgendaItem>
        <AgendaItemHeader
          title="Computational Complexity (Jon Lenchner - IBM)"
          duration="30 minutes"
        ></AgendaItemHeader>
        <AgendaItemDesc>
          <AgendaItemDescItem text="Time and Space Complexity: P vs. NP and Related Questions"></AgendaItemDescItem>
          <AgendaItemDescItem text="Descriptive Complexity"></AgendaItemDescItem>
          <AgendaItemDescItem text="Bridging from Descriptive Complexity to Time and Space Complexity via Games"></AgendaItemDescItem>
        </AgendaItemDesc>
      </AgendaItem>
      <AgendaItem>
        <AgendaItemHeader
          title="IBM Research in Complexity, Part I: Theory of Real-Valued Logics (Ryan Riegel - IBM, Ron Fagin - IBM)"
          duration="30 minutes"
        ></AgendaItemHeader>
        <AgendaItemDesc>
          <AgendaItemDescItem text="Allowing sentences to take values other than “true” or “false”"></AgendaItemDescItem>
          <AgendaItemDescItem text="A rich class of real-valued logic sentences"></AgendaItemDescItem>
          <AgendaItemDescItem text="A sound and complete axiomatization"></AgendaItemDescItem>
        </AgendaItemDesc>
      </AgendaItem>
      <AgendaItem>
        <AgendaItemHeader
          title="IBM Research in Complexity, Part II: Games and Complexity Classes (Rik Sengupta - IBM)"
          duration="30 minutes"
        ></AgendaItemHeader>
        <AgendaItemDesc>
          <AgendaItemDescItem text="From Ehrenfecht-Fraisse Games to Multi-Structural Games"></AgendaItemDescItem>
          <AgendaItemDescItem text="From Multi-Structural Games to Syntactic Games"></AgendaItemDescItem>
          <AgendaItemDescItem text="Open Questions"></AgendaItemDescItem>
        </AgendaItemDesc>
      </AgendaItem>
    </Agenda>
  </EventSession>
</EventTable>

## Day 2

<EventTable>
  <EventSession>
    <EventSessionHeader title="Session 1: Machine Learning" time="08:30 - 10:30ET"></EventSessionHeader>
    <Agenda>
      <AgendaItem>
        <AgendaItemHeader title="What can Transformers do? (Mark Wegman - IBM)" duration="1 hour"></AgendaItemHeader>
        <AgendaItemDesc>
          <AgendaItemDescItem text="Computational power of transformers"></AgendaItemDescItem>
          <AgendaItemDescItem text="What limits their power and what means there are around those limits?"></AgendaItemDescItem>
          <AgendaItemDescItem text="Theoretical power of a transformer and the relation to their behavior in practice"></AgendaItemDescItem>
        </AgendaItemDesc>
      </AgendaItem>
      <AgendaItem>
        <AgendaItemHeader title="Inductive Logic Programming with LNN (Prithviraj Sen - IBM, Sanjeeb Dash - IBM)" duration="20 minutes"></AgendaItemHeader>
        <AgendaItemDesc>
          <AgendaItemDescItem text="Intro to Inductive Logic Programming (ILP)"></AgendaItemDescItem>
          <AgendaItemDescItem text="Generating LNNs for ILP"></AgendaItemDescItem>
          <AgendaItemDescItem text="Experimental ResAgendaItemDescts: Knowledge Base Completion (KBC)"></AgendaItemDescItem>
        </AgendaItemDesc>
      </AgendaItem>
      <AgendaItem>
        <AgendaItemHeader title="NS architecture zoo (Tengfei Ma - IBM, Ronny Luss - IBM)" duration="10 minutes"></AgendaItemHeader>
      <AgendaItemDesc>
        <AgendaItemDescItem text="LNN for Times Series"></AgendaItemDescItem>
          <AgendaItemDescItem text="LNN for Mixed Models"></AgendaItemDescItem>
        </AgendaItemDesc>
      </AgendaItem>
      <AgendaItem>
        <AgendaItemHeader title="Compositional Generalization ( Tim Klinger - IBM)" duration="30 minutes"></AgendaItemHeader>
     <AgendaItemDesc>
        <AgendaItemDescItem text="Introduction and review"></AgendaItemDescItem>
         <AgendaItemDescItem text="A start at a formal characterization and theory"></AgendaItemDescItem>
         <AgendaItemDescItem text="Building models which compositionally generalize"></AgendaItemDescItem>
      </AgendaItemDesc>
      </AgendaItem>
    </Agenda>
  </EventSession>
  <EventSession>
    <EventSessionHeader title="Session 2: NLP via logic" time="11:00 - 13:00ET"></EventSessionHeader>
    <Agenda>
      <AgendaItem>
        <AgendaItemHeader title="Deep Semantic Parsing with Abstract Meaning Representation (Ramon Astudillo - IBM)" duration="30 minutes"></AgendaItemHeader>
      <AgendaItemDesc>
          <AgendaItemDescItem text="AMR as Deep Semantic Representation"></AgendaItemDescItem>
          <AgendaItemDescItem text="AMR parsing and AMR-to-text machine learning approaches"></AgendaItemDescItem>
          <AgendaItemDescItem text="Incorporating structure to Large Language Models for AMR parsing"></AgendaItemDescItem>
      </AgendaItemDesc>
      </AgendaItem>
      <AgendaItem>
        <AgendaItemHeader title="Entity Linking (Dinesh Garg - IBM)" duration="30 minutes"></AgendaItemHeader>
        <AgendaItemDesc>
          <AgendaItemDescItem text="Setup: What do we mean by entity, mention, and linking"></AgendaItemDescItem>
          <AgendaItemDescItem text="Linking over knowledge graphs"></AgendaItemDescItem>
          <AgendaItemDescItem text="Linking over relational databases"></AgendaItemDescItem>
        </AgendaItemDesc>
      </AgendaItem>
      <AgendaItem>
        <AgendaItemHeader title="Challenges and Approaches for Reliable Reasoning with Foundation Models: An Abstractive Summarization Use-case (Pavan Kapanipathi - IBM, Hans Florian - IBM)" duration="1 hour"></AgendaItemHeader>
        <AgendaItemDesc>
          <AgendaItemDescItem text="Reliable Reasoning with Foundation Models"></AgendaItemDescItem>
          <AgendaItemDescItem text="Abstractive Summarization: Reasoning and Factuality in Summarization"></AgendaItemDescItem>
          <AgendaItemDescItem text="Challenges and Neuro-Symbolic Approaches"></AgendaItemDescItem>
        </AgendaItemDesc>
      </AgendaItem>
    </Agenda>
  </EventSession>
  <EventSession>
    <EventSessionHeader title="Session 3: Sequential Decision Making" time="13:30 - 15:30ET"></EventSessionHeader>
    <Agenda>
      <AgendaItem>
        <AgendaItemHeader title="Theory and practice of RL (Miao Liu - IBM)" duration="30 minutes"></AgendaItemHeader>
        <AgendaItemDesc>
          <AgendaItemDescItem text="Core elements in RL"></AgendaItemDescItem>
          <AgendaItemDescItem text="Computational approaches and RL tools"></AgendaItemDescItem>
          <AgendaItemDescItem text="Important mechanisms - Hierarchical RL and Multiagent RL"></AgendaItemDescItem>
        </AgendaItemDesc>
      </AgendaItem>
      <AgendaItem>
        <AgendaItemHeader title="Theory and practice of AI Planning (Shirin Sohrabi - IBM, Michael Katz - IBM)" duration="30 minutes"></AgendaItemHeader>
        <AgendaItemDesc>
          <AgendaItemDescItem text="What is planning and why is it hard"></AgendaItemDescItem>
          <AgendaItemDescItem text="Computational approaches to classical planning"></AgendaItemDescItem>
          <AgendaItemDescItem text="Planners and planning tools"></AgendaItemDescItem>
        </AgendaItemDesc>
      </AgendaItem>
      <AgendaItem>
        <AgendaItemHeader title="Integrating Planning and RL (Junkyu Lee - IBM, Tim Klinger - IBM)" duration="30 minutes"></AgendaItemHeader>
        <AgendaItemDesc>
          <AgendaItemDescItem text="Introduction to integrating planning and RL"></AgendaItemDescItem>
          <AgendaItemDescItem text="AI Planning as annotation of RL"></AgendaItemDescItem>
          <AgendaItemDescItem text="Demonstration of libraries for planning annotated RL tasks"></AgendaItemDescItem>
        </AgendaItemDesc>
      </AgendaItem>
      <AgendaItem>
        <AgendaItemHeader title="Logical optimal actions (Don Joven - IBM, Maxwell Crouse - IBM)" duration="30 minutes"></AgendaItemHeader>
        <AgendaItemDesc>
          <AgendaItemDescItem text="Text-based games as an application environment"></AgendaItemDescItem>
          <AgendaItemDescItem text="LNN rule induction for learning world models"></AgendaItemDescItem>
          <AgendaItemDescItem text="The situation calculus and theorem proving applied to planning"></AgendaItemDescItem>
        </AgendaItemDesc>
      </AgendaItem>
    </Agenda>
  </EventSession>
  <EventSession>
    <EventSessionHeader title="Session 4: NS Toolkit" time="16:00 - 17:00ET"></EventSessionHeader>
    <Agenda>
      <AgendaItem>
        <AgendaItemHeader title="Neuro-symbolic Toolkit (Naweed Khan - IBM)" duration="1 hour"></AgendaItemHeader>
        <AgendaItemDesc>
          <AgendaItemDescItem text="Logical Neural Networks (LNN)"></AgendaItemDescItem>
          <AgendaItemDescItem text="Universal Logic Knowledge Base (ULKB)"></AgendaItemDescItem>
          <AgendaItemDescItem text="Logical Optimal Actions (LOA)"></AgendaItemDescItem>
          <AgendaItemDescItem text="Knowledge Explorer System (KES)"></AgendaItemDescItem>
        </AgendaItemDesc>
      </AgendaItem>
    </Agenda>
  </EventSession>
</EventTable>

## Organizers

<People>
<Person name="Asim Munawar" url="https://researcher.draco.res.ibm.com/researcher/view.php?person=ibm-asim" affiliation="IBM Research" img="https://s3.us.cloud-object-storage.appdomain.cloud/res-photos/9443.jpg"></Person>

<Person name="Jon Lenchner" url="https://researcher.watson.ibm.com/researcher/view.php?person=us-lenchner" affiliation="IBM Research" img="https://s3.us.cloud-object-storage.appdomain.cloud/res-photos/1227.jpg"></Person>

<Person name="Francesca Rossi" url="https://research.ibm.com/" affiliation="IBM Research" img="https://everydayicons.jp/wp/wp-content/themes/everydayicons/icons/thumbs/ei-person.png"></Person>

<Person name="Lior Horesh" url="https://research.ibm.com/" affiliation="IBM Research" img="https://everydayicons.jp/wp/wp-content/themes/everydayicons/icons/thumbs/ei-person.png"></Person>
</People>

## Speakers

<People>
<Person name="Alexander Gray" url="https://research.gatech.edu/data/seminar-series/alexander-gray" affiliation="IBM Research" img="https://cs.uchicago.edu/wp-content/uploads/2019/10/gray_alex_0319_033-panel_cut_lower-250x250.jpg"></Person>

<Person name="Ramon Fernandez Astudillo" url="https://ramon-astudillo.github.io/" affiliation="IBM Research" img="https://mitibmwatsonailab.mit.edu/wp-content/uploads/2021/12/ramon.png"></Person>

<Person name="Guilherme Lima" url="https://researcher.watson.ibm.com/researcher/view.php?person=ibm-Guilherme.Lima" affiliation="IBM Research" img="https://s3.us.cloud-object-storage.appdomain.cloud/res-photos/8332.jpg"></Person>

<Person name="Alexandre Rademaker" url="http://arademaker.github.io" affiliation="IBM Research - Brazil" img="https://emap.fgv.br/sites/default/files/styles/square_300x300/public/2021-04/alexandre.rademaker_0.jpg?itok=-vafaXYO"></Person>

<Person name="Maria Chang" url="https://researcher.watson.ibm.com/researcher/view.php?person=ibm-Maria.Chang" affiliation="IBM Research" img="https://media-exp2.licdn.com/dms/image/C4D03AQGi4sxODY0BJQ/profile-displayphoto-shrink_800_800/0/1584576604928?e=1661990400&v=beta&t=PrSO79Z48tE7VanbmFjo-wivhLA7Jmo0s-ZkmF3yJ3g"></Person>

<Person name="Prithviraj Sen" url="https://researcher.watson.ibm.com/researcher/view.php?person=us-senp" affiliation="IBM Research" img="https://s3.us.cloud-object-storage.appdomain.cloud/res-photos/6268.jpg"></Person>

<Person name="Mark Wegman" url="https://researcher.ibm.com/person/us-wegman" affiliation="IBM Research" img="https://s3.us.cloud-object-storage.appdomain.cloud/res-photos/2.jpg"></Person>

<Person name="Michael Katz" url="https://aiplanning-tutorial.github.io/txt/michael-bio.txt" affiliation="IBM Research" img="https://aiplanning-tutorial.github.io/images/Michael-Katz.jpg"></Person>

<Person name="Ronald Fagin" url="http://researcher.ibm.com/person/us-fagin" affiliation="IBM Research" img="https://s3.us.cloud-object-storage.appdomain.cloud/res-photos/500.jpg"></Person>

<Person name="Marco Carmosino" url="https://research.ibm.com/" affiliation="IBM Research" img="https://s33897.pcdn.co/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/resize-15982973651634779654DSC01944.jpg"></Person>

<Person name="Naweed Khan" url="https://researcher.draco.res.ibm.com/researcher/view.php?person=ibm-Naweed.Khan" affiliation="IBM Research - Africa" img="https://s3.us.cloud-object-storage.appdomain.cloud/res-photos/10034.jpg"></Person>

<Person name="Don Joven Agravante" url="https://researcher.watson.ibm.com/researcher/view.php?person=ibm-Don.Joven.R.Agravante" affiliation="IBM Research" img="https://s3.us.cloud-object-storage.appdomain.cloud/res-photos/9884.jpg"></Person>

<Person name="Maxwell Crouse" url="https://researcher.ibm.com/researcher/view_person_pubs.php?person=ibm-Maxwell.Crouse&t=1" affiliation="IBM Research" img="https://www.mccormick.northwestern.edu/computer-science/images/news/2022/alumni-profile-maxwell-crouse-ibm-research-max-crouse.jpg"></Person>

<Person name="Ronny Luss" url="https://researcher.watson.ibm.com/researcher/view.php?person=us-rluss" affiliation="IBM Research" img="https://dl.boxcloud.com/api/2.0/internal_files/980726236505/versions/1060490840105/representations/jpg_paged_2048x2048/content/1.jpg?access_token=1!FO0EuA-GeBT0NYXmfjf3pqJDXpcroASsf8asV5TwgFIThT_TVG-JUfAPwJSQTC18uCZ7GHnoSvar_UIYBc78fX8tl2oM3MXcf1E2JVCrPK5EXm766e1v_P9XhiFLOl_WRx_MTQTMewnw2UggJM_-NxhvUVRyg1V4Xf4JJyN63PKrGHbMNIudi9r7xaP2Pvty0KqPJ6WJOUKGfTnngJZCqOlOdsujWimiWA56uCoV7ErbOwC2kSGAFsAKRJG4jyr0CCVDtniTcDFy6LA-HgFHwMqKMrZpXAnFhaF5pPGgNsMhjzPjMj-nT7FRguGjWImL-8pMJWhuxOusQurl7nkNoAfEBo_Ftj8JQj7DFBS_Txb9sneDxrpyy_n-BRquzqD4X3E9INwTQe1DowPRoEUXocmZaWOeXZeaYRmpt1v_S_4k3GTb-TE3fDI7iHFoLVhqzEVwNSFQo_i5ZTtCGYd-PbrY-bB3MOXDGzYE49aslh6cT2gG9t-HeH4mrUgTg9qnQ1xAEZs2GppQg5y-MYuhziREBY64nnYEUjOarF78qtUgXL2UANjvJgyUjl-zj55eWZcJ7qfFDrnI4GD-j4G73d7PGMhLWeD33W3khA6l91m_5MIg7CBiDMFkPON0W5ZGSr9qfGYsM46zHGMV9iyQI-3NB_yHnyu_8i3Dc9zXqZTyvt-eTQyj6HyF2gfdoA7kJtbk1jUuUnS2mA3x197hFa_XXoXdcTCT2xOEt5WW11TurKc.&shared_link=https%3A%2F%2Fibm.ent.box.com%2Fs%2Flb6gzse5jv0v08znfv86eyx0edyp0xk8&box_client_name=box-content-preview&box_client_version=2.84.0"></Person>

<Person name="Junkyu Lee" url="https://researcher.watson.ibm.com/researcher/view.php?person=ibm-Junkyu.Lee" affiliation="IBM Research" img="https://s3.us.cloud-object-storage.appdomain.cloud/res-photos/10035.jpg"></Person>

<Person name="Dinesh Garg" url="https://researcher.watson.ibm.com/researcher/view.php?person=in-garg.dinesh" affiliation="IBM Research" img="https://s3.us.cloud-object-storage.appdomain.cloud/res-photos/2504.jpg"></Person>

</People>

frontmatter.title: Neuro-Symbolic AI Summer School (8-9 Aug 2022)
frontmatter.description: Page for IBM Neuro-Symbolic AI Summer School 2022

title: Neuro-Symbolic AI Summer School (8-9 Aug 2022)
description: Page for IBM Neuro-Symbolic AI Summer School 2022
date: 26 May 2022
---

## IBM Neuro-Symbolic AI Summer School 2022

#### August 8-9, 2022

## Day 1

<EventTable>
  <EventSession>
    <EventSessionHeader
      title="Session 1: Opening"
      time="08:30 - 10:30ET"
    ></EventSessionHeader>
    <Agenda>
      <AgendaItem>
        <AgendaItemHeader
          title="Opening"
          duration="20 minutes"
        ></AgendaItemHeader>
        <AgendaItemDesc>
          <AgendaItemDescItem text="Welcome (Alexander Gray - IBM)"></AgendaItemDescItem>
          <AgendaItemDescItem text="Motivation (Francesca Rossi - IBM)"></AgendaItemDescItem>
          <AgendaItemDescItem text="Summer school Intro (Jon Lenchner - IBM)"></AgendaItemDescItem>
          <AgendaItemDescItem text="NS Badge (Asim Munawar - IBM)"></AgendaItemDescItem>
        </AgendaItemDesc>
      </AgendaItem>
      <AgendaItem>
        <AgendaItemHeader
          title="Neuro-symbolic AI overview ()"
          duration="1 hour"
        ></AgendaItemHeader>
      </AgendaItem>
      <AgendaItem>
        <AgendaItemHeader
          title="IBM’s perspective (Alexander Gray - IBM)"
          duration="40 minutes"
        ></AgendaItemHeader>
      </AgendaItem>
    </Agenda>
  </EventSession>
  <EventSession>
    <EventSessionHeader
      title="Session 2: Knowledge"
      time="11:00 - 13:00ET"
    ></EventSessionHeader>
    <Agenda>
      <AgendaItem>
        <AgendaItemHeader
          title="Knowledge Foundations for AI Applications (Maria Chang - IBM)"
          duration="1 hour"
        ></AgendaItemHeader>
        <AgendaItemDesc>
          <AgendaItemDescItem text="Knowledge Acquisition and Induction"></AgendaItemDescItem>
          <AgendaItemDescItem text="Semantic Web"></AgendaItemDescItem>
          <AgendaItemDescItem text="Logic for AI"></AgendaItemDescItem>
        </AgendaItemDesc>
      </AgendaItem>
      <AgendaItem>
        <AgendaItemHeader
          title="IBM Research Overview Part 1: Universal Logic Knowledge Base (Rosario Uceda-Sosa - IBM)"
          duration="25 minutes"
        ></AgendaItemHeader>
        <AgendaItemDesc>
          <AgendaItemDescItem text="Interlinked KBs for broad encyclopedic, linguistic, and commonsense knowledge"></AgendaItemDescItem>
          <AgendaItemDescItem text="Supporting foundation for neuro-symbolic reasoning"></AgendaItemDescItem>
        </AgendaItemDesc>
      </AgendaItem>
      <AgendaItem>
        <AgendaItemHeader
          title="IBM Research Overview Part 2: Logic language and hyperknowledge (Guilherme Lima - IBM)"
          duration="25 minutes"
        ></AgendaItemHeader>
        <AgendaItemDesc>
          <AgendaItemDescItem text="Higher order reasoning"></AgendaItemDescItem>
          <AgendaItemDescItem text="Python and SPARQL integration"></AgendaItemDescItem>
          <AgendaItemDescItem text="Hyperknowledge infrastructure"></AgendaItemDescItem>
        </AgendaItemDesc>
      </AgendaItem>
      <AgendaItem>
        <AgendaItemHeader
          title="IBM Research Overview Part 3: Deep linguistic processing (Alexandre Rademaker - IBM)"
          duration="10 minutes"
        ></AgendaItemHeader>
        <AgendaItemDesc>
          <AgendaItemDescItem text="Minimal recursive semantics and abstract meaning representation"></AgendaItemDescItem>
          <AgendaItemDescItem text="Open source tooling"></AgendaItemDescItem>
        </AgendaItemDesc>
      </AgendaItem>
    </Agenda>
  </EventSession>
  <EventSession>
    <EventSessionHeader
      title="Session 3: Reasoning"
      time="13:30 - 15:30ET"
    ></EventSessionHeader>
    <Agenda>
      <AgendaItem>
        <AgendaItemHeader
          title="A Very Brief Introduction to Logic and Reasoning (Achille - IBM)"
          duration="1 hour"
        ></AgendaItemHeader>
        <AgendaItemDesc>
          <AgendaItemDescItem text="First order logic (FOL) syntax and model theoretic semantics"></AgendaItemDescItem>
          <AgendaItemDescItem text="FOL reasoning and deductive systems"></AgendaItemDescItem>
          <AgendaItemDescItem text="FOL Extensions"></AgendaItemDescItem>
        </AgendaItemDesc>
      </AgendaItem>
      <AgendaItem>
        <AgendaItemHeader
          title="Learnable Reasoning (Ndivhuwo - IBM, Hima Karanam - IBM)"
          duration="1 hour"
        ></AgendaItemHeader>
        <AgendaItemDesc>
          <AgendaItemDescItem text="Overview of Learning to Reason (e.g., neural theorem provers, MLNs, LTNs, etc)"></AgendaItemDescItem>
          <AgendaItemDescItem text="Introduction to LNNs - our framework for Learnable Reasoning"></AgendaItemDescItem>
          <AgendaItemDescItem text="Applications of LNNS"></AgendaItemDescItem>
        </AgendaItemDesc>
      </AgendaItem>
    </Agenda>
  </EventSession>
  <EventSession>
    <EventSessionHeader
      title="Session 4: Theory of Reasoning"
      time="16:00 - 18:00ET"
    ></EventSessionHeader>
    <Agenda>
      <AgendaItem>
        <AgendaItemHeader
          title="Foundations of Reasoning with Classical Logic (Marco Carmosino - IBM)"
          duration="30 minutes"
        ></AgendaItemHeader>
        <AgendaItemDesc>
          <AgendaItemDescItem text='Desiderata: what is a logic, and what makes a logic "good"?'></AgendaItemDescItem>
          <AgendaItemDescItem text="Example: First-Order Logic on finite graphs."></AgendaItemDescItem>
          <AgendaItemDescItem text="Game-based semantics for First-Order Logic"></AgendaItemDescItem>
        </AgendaItemDesc>
      </AgendaItem>
      <AgendaItem>
        <AgendaItemHeader
          title="Computational Complexity (Jon Lenchner - IBM)"
          duration="30 minutes"
        ></AgendaItemHeader>
        <AgendaItemDesc>
          <AgendaItemDescItem text="Time and Space Complexity: P vs. NP and Related Questions"></AgendaItemDescItem>
          <AgendaItemDescItem text="Descriptive Complexity"></AgendaItemDescItem>
          <AgendaItemDescItem text="Bridging from Descriptive Complexity to Time and Space Complexity via Games"></AgendaItemDescItem>
        </AgendaItemDesc>
      </AgendaItem>
      <AgendaItem>
        <AgendaItemHeader
          title="IBM Research in Complexity, Part I: Theory of Real-Valued Logics (Ryan Riegel - IBM, Ron Fagin - IBM)"
          duration="30 minutes"
        ></AgendaItemHeader>
        <AgendaItemDesc>
          <AgendaItemDescItem text="Allowing sentences to take values other than “true” or “false”"></AgendaItemDescItem>
          <AgendaItemDescItem text="A rich class of real-valued logic sentences"></AgendaItemDescItem>
          <AgendaItemDescItem text="A sound and complete axiomatization"></AgendaItemDescItem>
        </AgendaItemDesc>
      </AgendaItem>
      <AgendaItem>
        <AgendaItemHeader
          title="IBM Research in Complexity, Part II: Games and Complexity Classes (Rik Sengupta - IBM)"
          duration="30 minutes"
        ></AgendaItemHeader>
        <AgendaItemDesc>
          <AgendaItemDescItem text="From Ehrenfecht-Fraisse Games to Multi-Structural Games"></AgendaItemDescItem>
          <AgendaItemDescItem text="From Multi-Structural Games to Syntactic Games"></AgendaItemDescItem>
          <AgendaItemDescItem text="Open Questions"></AgendaItemDescItem>
        </AgendaItemDesc>
      </AgendaItem>
    </Agenda>
  </EventSession>
</EventTable>

## Day 2

<EventTable>
  <EventSession>
    <EventSessionHeader title="Session 1: Machine Learning" time="08:30 - 10:30ET"></EventSessionHeader>
    <Agenda>
      <AgendaItem>
        <AgendaItemHeader title="What can Transformers do? (Mark Wegman - IBM)" duration="1 hour"></AgendaItemHeader>
        <AgendaItemDesc>
          <AgendaItemDescItem text="Computational power of transformers"></AgendaItemDescItem>
          <AgendaItemDescItem text="What limits their power and what means there are around those limits?"></AgendaItemDescItem>
          <AgendaItemDescItem text="Theoretical power of a transformer and the relation to their behavior in practice"></AgendaItemDescItem>
        </AgendaItemDesc>
      </AgendaItem>
      <AgendaItem>
        <AgendaItemHeader title="Inductive Logic Programming with LNN (Prithviraj Sen - IBM, Sanjeeb Dash - IBM)" duration="20 minutes"></AgendaItemHeader>
        <AgendaItemDesc>
          <AgendaItemDescItem text="Intro to Inductive Logic Programming (ILP)"></AgendaItemDescItem>
          <AgendaItemDescItem text="Generating LNNs for ILP"></AgendaItemDescItem>
          <AgendaItemDescItem text="Experimental ResAgendaItemDescts: Knowledge Base Completion (KBC)"></AgendaItemDescItem>
        </AgendaItemDesc>
      </AgendaItem>
      <AgendaItem>
        <AgendaItemHeader title="NS architecture zoo (Tengfei Ma - IBM, Ronny Luss - IBM)" duration="10 minutes"></AgendaItemHeader>
      <AgendaItemDesc>
        <AgendaItemDescItem text="LNN for Times Series"></AgendaItemDescItem>
          <AgendaItemDescItem text="LNN for Mixed Models"></AgendaItemDescItem>
        </AgendaItemDesc>
      </AgendaItem>
      <AgendaItem>
        <AgendaItemHeader title="Compositional Generalization ( Tim Klinger - IBM)" duration="30 minutes"></AgendaItemHeader>
     <AgendaItemDesc>
        <AgendaItemDescItem text="Introduction and review"></AgendaItemDescItem>
         <AgendaItemDescItem text="A start at a formal characterization and theory"></AgendaItemDescItem>
         <AgendaItemDescItem text="Building models which compositionally generalize"></AgendaItemDescItem>
      </AgendaItemDesc>
      </AgendaItem>
    </Agenda>
  </EventSession>
  <EventSession>
    <EventSessionHeader title="Session 2: NLP via logic" time="11:00 - 13:00ET"></EventSessionHeader>
    <Agenda>
      <AgendaItem>
        <AgendaItemHeader title="Deep Semantic Parsing with Abstract Meaning Representation (Ramon Astudillo - IBM)" duration="30 minutes"></AgendaItemHeader>
      <AgendaItemDesc>
          <AgendaItemDescItem text="AMR as Deep Semantic Representation"></AgendaItemDescItem>
          <AgendaItemDescItem text="AMR parsing and AMR-to-text machine learning approaches"></AgendaItemDescItem>
          <AgendaItemDescItem text="Incorporating structure to Large Language Models for AMR parsing"></AgendaItemDescItem>
      </AgendaItemDesc>
      </AgendaItem>
      <AgendaItem>
        <AgendaItemHeader title="Entity Linking (Dinesh Garg - IBM)" duration="30 minutes"></AgendaItemHeader>
        <AgendaItemDesc>
          <AgendaItemDescItem text="Setup: What do we mean by entity, mention, and linking"></AgendaItemDescItem>
          <AgendaItemDescItem text="Linking over knowledge graphs"></AgendaItemDescItem>
          <AgendaItemDescItem text="Linking over relational databases"></AgendaItemDescItem>
        </AgendaItemDesc>
      </AgendaItem>
      <AgendaItem>
        <AgendaItemHeader title="Challenges and Approaches for Reliable Reasoning with Foundation Models: An Abstractive Summarization Use-case (Pavan Kapanipathi - IBM, Hans Florian - IBM)" duration="1 hour"></AgendaItemHeader>
        <AgendaItemDesc>
          <AgendaItemDescItem text="Reliable Reasoning with Foundation Models"></AgendaItemDescItem>
          <AgendaItemDescItem text="Abstractive Summarization: Reasoning and Factuality in Summarization"></AgendaItemDescItem>
          <AgendaItemDescItem text="Challenges and Neuro-Symbolic Approaches"></AgendaItemDescItem>
        </AgendaItemDesc>
      </AgendaItem>
    </Agenda>
  </EventSession>
  <EventSession>
    <EventSessionHeader title="Session 3: Sequential Decision Making" time="13:30 - 15:30ET"></EventSessionHeader>
    <Agenda>
      <AgendaItem>
        <AgendaItemHeader title="Theory and practice of RL (Miao Liu - IBM)" duration="30 minutes"></AgendaItemHeader>
        <AgendaItemDesc>
          <AgendaItemDescItem text="Core elements in RL"></AgendaItemDescItem>
          <AgendaItemDescItem text="Computational approaches and RL tools"></AgendaItemDescItem>
          <AgendaItemDescItem text="Important mechanisms - Hierarchical RL and Multiagent RL"></AgendaItemDescItem>
        </AgendaItemDesc>
      </AgendaItem>
      <AgendaItem>
        <AgendaItemHeader title="Theory and practice of AI Planning (Shirin Sohrabi - IBM, Michael Katz - IBM)" duration="30 minutes"></AgendaItemHeader>
        <AgendaItemDesc>
          <AgendaItemDescItem text="What is planning and why is it hard"></AgendaItemDescItem>
          <AgendaItemDescItem text="Computational approaches to classical planning"></AgendaItemDescItem>
          <AgendaItemDescItem text="Planners and planning tools"></AgendaItemDescItem>
        </AgendaItemDesc>
      </AgendaItem>
      <AgendaItem>
        <AgendaItemHeader title="Integrating Planning and RL (Junkyu Lee - IBM, Tim Klinger - IBM)" duration="30 minutes"></AgendaItemHeader>
        <AgendaItemDesc>
          <AgendaItemDescItem text="Introduction to integrating planning and RL"></AgendaItemDescItem>
          <AgendaItemDescItem text="AI Planning as annotation of RL"></AgendaItemDescItem>
          <AgendaItemDescItem text="Demonstration of libraries for planning annotated RL tasks"></AgendaItemDescItem>
        </AgendaItemDesc>
      </AgendaItem>
      <AgendaItem>
        <AgendaItemHeader title="Logical optimal actions (Don Joven - IBM, Maxwell Crouse - IBM)" duration="30 minutes"></AgendaItemHeader>
        <AgendaItemDesc>
          <AgendaItemDescItem text="Text-based games as an application environment"></AgendaItemDescItem>
          <AgendaItemDescItem text="LNN rule induction for learning world models"></AgendaItemDescItem>
          <AgendaItemDescItem text="The situation calculus and theorem proving applied to planning"></AgendaItemDescItem>
        </AgendaItemDesc>
      </AgendaItem>
    </Agenda>
  </EventSession>
  <EventSession>
    <EventSessionHeader title="Session 4: NS Toolkit" time="16:00 - 17:00ET"></EventSessionHeader>
    <Agenda>
      <AgendaItem>
        <AgendaItemHeader title="Neuro-symbolic Toolkit (Naweed Khan - IBM)" duration="1 hour"></AgendaItemHeader>
        <AgendaItemDesc>
          <AgendaItemDescItem text="Logical Neural Networks (LNN)"></AgendaItemDescItem>
          <AgendaItemDescItem text="Universal Logic Knowledge Base (ULKB)"></AgendaItemDescItem>
          <AgendaItemDescItem text="Logical Optimal Actions (LOA)"></AgendaItemDescItem>
          <AgendaItemDescItem text="Knowledge Explorer System (KES)"></AgendaItemDescItem>
        </AgendaItemDesc>
      </AgendaItem>
    </Agenda>
  </EventSession>
</EventTable>
